article.name: How to Use the Vendor Dashboard
article.title: How to Use the Vendor Dashboard
article.body:
The Vendor Risk Management (VRM) module of the GRC platform lets you centralize your third-party risk management processes. You can prequalify risk, assess your vendors, and conduct remediation efforts all in one platform. The VRM module is available to Platinum subscriptions.

For an overview of the VRM module, see our Vendor Risk Management Module Guide.

This article goes over your Vendor Dashboard, which is found under your Vendor Risk Management module. The Vendor Dashboard provides an overview of the levels of risk inherited when working with your vendors, as well as the current status of your questionnaires and questionnaire issues.

There are five sections that make up the vendor dashboard. Use the jump links below to learn more about each section. 

Vendor Score

The Vendor Score section of the dashboard consists of a table and a bar graph displaying all of the vendors you've added to your account and their associated vendor score. The vendor score is the average score of all questionnaires that the vendor has completed. This score is also displayed on each vendor profile. 

For more information about the Vendor List, vendor profiles, and vendor scores, see our How to Create and Manage Vendor Profiles article.

Vendor Status

The Vendor Status section of the dashboard consists of a table and pie chart displaying the status of each of the vendor profiles you've added to your account. The vendor profile must be in the Active or Pending Approval status before you can send questionnaire assessments to the vendor contact. The vendor statuses are Active, Inactive, Pending Approval, Rejected, and Incomplete.

To learn how to work with vendor profiles, see our How to Create and Manage Vendor Profiles article.

Vendor Issues

The Vendor Issues section of the dashboard displays the issues you've created in response to the questionnaire answers that your vendors have provided. You can click the drop-down arrow next to a vendor's name to expand all of the issues for the vendor. Then, you click the description of an issue under the Issue Description column to open the issue.

For more information about creating issues, see our How to Review Questionnaires and Create Issues article. 

Outstanding Vendor Questionnaires

This section of the dashboard displays all of the questionnaire assessments that have been sent to your vendors and are currently in progress, finalized and awaiting review, or currently under review.

If the questionnaire has been finalized by your vendor contact, you can use the blue link under the Questionnaire column to navigate directly to the Questionnaire Review page. 

For more information about reviewing questionnaires, see our How to Review Questionnaires and Create Issues article.

Scheduled Questionnaires

This section of the dashboard displays a calendar showing all of the questionnaires that you've already sent and will send on a recurring schedule.

Each iteration of a questionnaire–whether it is sent one-time or on a recurring frequency–will have one calendar entry. The calendar entries are listed on the date that the questionnaire was sent or is scheduled to be sent. 

The color of each calendar entry represents the current status of the questionnaire. The colors change as changes in status occur. 

  • Sent: The questionnaire has been sent to the vendor and the vendor user has not yet finalized the questionnaire. If the vendor has started the questionnaire, their progress is displayed in their vendor profile, under the Issues tab. 
  • Pending Review: The questionnaire has been finalized by the vendor user, but the KCM administrator has not begun the review process.
  • In Review: The KCM administrator has begun, but not finished the review process for this questionnaire.
  • Reviewed: The KCM administrator has completed reviewing this questionnaire.

If the questionnaire has been finalized by the vendor user, click the questionnaire name to open the Questionnaire Review page. Click the user icon on the right side of the calendar entry to open the vendor profile that is associated with this questionnaire instance.

To learn more about reviewing questionnaires, see our How to Review Questionnaires and Create Issues article.

images.alt:
This image displays a "Vendor Score" dashboard UI, featuring both a detailed data table and a summary bar chart.

**Header and Navigation:**
* The page title is "Vendor Score."
* A blue rectangular button labeled "Back" is positioned in the top right corner.

**Left Pane (Data Table):**
* A search input field labeled "Search by Score..." is present above the table.
* The table lists individual vendor records and includes three sortable columns:
    1. **Name:** Lists vendor names as clickable blue hyperlinks (e.g., "Logistics Management Organization," "Supply Chain Distribution," "Customer Management Service Provider, Inc.").
    2. **Contact Email:** Contains censored/redacted email addresses.
    3. **Score:** Displays percentage scores (99.3%, 93.2%, 98.6%).
* A summary count is located below the table, stating "**3 records**."

**Right Pane (Bar Chart):**
* The chart is titled "Vendor Score."
* The Y-axis is labeled "Total Number of Vendors" and is scaled from 0 to 4.
* The X-axis is labeled "Vendor Score" and displays five score ranges: 90-100%, 80-89%, 70-79%, 60-69%, and 0-59%.
* The chart shows that all 3 vendors fall within the **90-100%** score range, represented by a blue bar marked with the value "**3**."
* The remaining score ranges (80-89%, 70-79%, 60-69%, 0-59%) all show a count of **0**.

This image displays a "Vendor Status" dashboard within a web application, divided into a data table (left) and a data visualization (right).

**Title and Structure:**
*   The main heading is **"Vendor Status"**.
*   The screen content is horizontally split between a data list and a pie chart.

**Left Panel: Data Table and Controls**
*   **Search Bar:** A white input field labeled "Search by Status..." is located above the table for filtering.
*   **Data Grid:** A table displays vendor information with three sortable columns (indicated by up/down arrow icons):
    *   **Name:** Lists vendor names (e.g., "Logistics Management Organization," "Supply Chain Distribution"). Names are rendered as clickable links (blue text).
    *   **Contact Email:** Contains placeholder/redacted email addresses.
    *   **Status:** Displays the vendor's status using color-coded tags:
        *   **Active (Green Tag):** Three records.
        *   **Inactive (Gray Tag):** One record.
        *   **Pending Approval (Orange Tag):** One record.
*   **Summary:** The table footer indicates the total count: **"5 records"**.

**Right Panel: Data Visualization (Pie Chart)**
*   **Chart Title:** **"Vendor by Status"**.
*   **Pie Chart:** A circular graph visually represents the distribution of vendor statuses based on percentage:
    *   **Active:** 60.0% (Light Blue section, largest slice).
    *   **Inactive:** 20.0% (Dark Gray/Black section).
    *   **Pending Approval:** 20.0% (Light Green section).

The image displays a dashboard interface titled **"Outstanding Vendor Questionnaires,"** consisting of a sortable data table and a visual status breakdown chart.

**Data Table (Left):**
The left pane is a paginated list of questionnaires with a search field labeled "Search Questionnaires..." and a "Page Size: 10" control. The table structure includes three sortable columns:

1.  **Vendor Name:** (e.g., "Supply Chain Distribution," "Accounting Services"). Vendor names are displayed as blue hyperlinks.
2.  **Questionnaire:** (e.g., "Cloud Security Alliance Questionnaire (CAIQ 2019) (57 Qs)," "CAIQ Full (2019)"). Questionnaire titles are displayed as blue hyperlinks, indicating navigation to a review page.
3.  **Status:** Displays the current questionnaire state using color-coded badges (e.g., **In Review** (Orange) and **Sent** (Blue)).

The table pagination footer shows Page **1** of 2 currently selected.

**Questionnaire Status Breakdown (Right):**
The right pane features a bar chart titled **"Questionnaire Status Breakdown."** The chart illustrates the total volume of outstanding questionnaires categorized by completion status:

*   **Complete Questionnaires:** 2 (Displayed in light blue).
*   **Incomplete Questionnaires:** 19 (Displayed in dark grey).

The Y-axis is scaled numerically (0, 15, 20) representing the count of questionnaires.

This image displays the **"Scheduled Questionnaires"** user interface, featuring a calendar view of tasks.

**UI Elements and Context:**

1.  **Title:** The page header identifies the function as "Scheduled Questionnaires."
2.  **Calendar Navigation Bar:** Located directly above the calendar grid.
    *   **Date Indicator:** Center text displays the current period: "August 2019."
    *   **View Toggles:** A segmented control group allows selection between calendar views: **Month** (currently active/selected), **Week**, and **Day**. (An external annotation confirms this functionality: "Click to toggle between calendar views.")
    *   **Period Navigation:** Left arrow (<) navigates to the previous month; the "TODAY >" control navigates to the current date or next period.
3.  **Calendar Grid:** Displays a standard month layout, starting on Sunday (date 28) and extending through Saturday (date 24).

**Data Visualization (Scheduled Questionnaires):**

Scheduled questionnaires are represented by colored event bars within the corresponding date cells.

*   **Color Coding:** Events are color-coded (e.g., green, orange, or a stack of blue/red).
*   **Specific Events:**
    *   **August 12 & 13:** Shows a green event bar labeled "External Vendor Questi..."
    *   **August 14:** Shows an orange event bar labeled "Cloud Security Alliance..."
    *   **August 20:** Displays a stack of seven events, including "Cloud Security Alliance...", "External Vendor Quest...", and multiple instances of "Testing Points." One event is prominently highlighted in red: "CAIQ Full (2019)."

This image illustrates the interactive elements within a task or calendar grid interface, specifically regarding vendor management and questionnaire review.

**UI Elements and Context:**

*   **Grid Interface:** The image displays columns numbered 13, 14, 20, and 21, representing days within a scheduling or monitoring view.
*   **Entries (Task Bars):** Entries are represented by horizontal, colored bars (e.g., orange or blue) within the day columns.
*   **Entry Content:** Each bar contains the name of a document or task (e.g., "External Vendor Questionnaire," "Cloud Security Alliance Questi...") and a white user/person icon positioned on the right.

**Functionality and Text Annotations:**

1.  **Questionnaire Access:** A callout points to the entry title text. The associated instruction is: "Click the name to review a finalized questionnaire." This action is used to open the security/vendor assessment document.
2.  **Vendor Profile Access:** A second callout points specifically to the user icon. The instruction is: "Click the user icon to open the applicable vendor profile."
3.  **Tooltip:** Hovering over the user icon activates a black rectangular tooltip displaying the text: "View Vendor."
